## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi again, I've got some more questions about VerusIDs and Verus in general. What's a limitation of creating a currency from an ID in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
Good question! In Verus, you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name (not its calculated ID). This is because using an i-address as a currency name can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. To avoid confusion, it is recommended not to create IDs with i-addresses as their names. Does that make sense?

**User:**
Another question about the Verus Desktop GUI: are there any limitations to using existing currency names?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, there is a limitation. In the current version of the Verus Desktop GUI, you cannot use existing currency names like BTC or ETH as a PBaaS chain. However, this limitation is considered errata and will be resolved before mainnet availability, allowing users to create PBaaS chains with these names.

**User:**
What about using the Verus software in general? Are there any disclaimers or terms of use I should be aware of?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, there are. The Verus software is experimental and unfinished, and users are advised to use it at their own risk. There is no warranty for any kind of damage. However, the software is open-source, and users are permitted to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and sell copies of the software, as long as the enclosed copyright notice and permission notice are included in all copies or substantial portions of the software. It's always important to read and understand the terms of use before using any software.
What is a limitation of creating a currency from an ID in Verus, and what is the recommended approach to avoid issues?

In Verus, you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name (not its calculated ID). This is because using an i-address as a currency name can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. To avoid confusion, it is recommended not to create IDs with i-addresses as their names.

### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.# DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage!
